00016 def _cmpPlotProperties(a,b):
00017     """Sort cmp-function for PlotProperties"""
00018     plotorder = [Volume, Streams, Surface, Contours, VelocityVectors, Line] 
00019     assert isinstance(a, PlotProperties)
00020     assert isinstance(b, PlotProperties)
00021     assert len(PlotProperties.__class__.__subclasses__(PlotProperties)) == \
00022                len(plotorder) # Check all subclasses is in plotorder
00023     return cmp(plotorder.index(a.__class__),plotorder.index(b.__class__))

00025 class MatplotlibBackend(BaseClass):
00026     def __init__(self):
00027         BaseClass.init(self)
00028         self.init()
00029         self._g_g = pylab

00032         # convert tables for formatstrings
00033         self._markers_markers = {
00034             '': '',
00035             '.': '.', # 'point',       
00036             'o': 'o', # 'circle',      
00037             'x': 'x', #' x-mark',       
00038             '+': '+', #'plus',              
00039             '*': '+', # 'star' --> plus,
00040             's': 's', # 'square',
00041             'd': 'd', # 'diamond',
00042             'v': 'v', # 'triangle (down)',
00043             '^': '^', # 'triangle (up)',
00044             '<': '<', # 'triangle (left)',
00045             '>': '>', # 'triangle (right)',
00046             'p': 'p', # 'pentagram',
00047             'h': 'h', # 'hexagram',
00048             }

00050     def _replot(self):
00051         """Replot all figures, all axis and all plotitems in backend,
00052         NOTE: The easyviz way is to only redraw last figure/axis
00053         """
00054         print "\nRunning _replot\n" 
00055 
00056         p = self._g_g
00057         p.close('all')
00058 
00059         # Update figures
00060         #for fignr, fig in self._figs.items(): 
00061         for fignr, fig in (self.get('curfig'), self.gcf()),: # Last figure
00062             print 'figure', fignr
00063             p.figure(fignr)
00064             #p.subplot(*(fig.get('axshape')+(fig.get('curax'),)))
00065             for axnr, ax  in fig.get('axes').items():
00066                 p.subplot(*(fig.get('axshape')+(axnr,)))
00067                 # Update axes limits
00068                 for i1,i2 in zip(ax._ranges, ax.get_limits()):
00069                     if i2 != None:
00070                         if i1 == 'xmin':
00071                             p.gca().set_xlim(xmin=i2)
00072                         elif i1 == 'xmax':
00073                             p.gca().set_xlim(xmax=i2)
00074                         elif i1 == 'ymin':
00075                             p.gca().set_ylim(ymin=i2)
00076                         elif i1 == 'ymax':
00077                             p.gca().set_ylim(ymax=i2)
00078                         else:
00079                             print 'not implemented:',i1,i2
00080                 # Titles
00081                 p.title(ax.get('title'))
00082                 p.xlabel(ax.get('xlabel'))
00083                 p.ylabel(ax.get('ylabel'), rotation='horizontal')
00084                 p.grid(ax.get('grid'))
00085                     
00086 
00087                 #p.axis({'tight':'tight'}[ax.get('mode')])
00088                 
00089 
00090                 p.hold(True)
00091                 plotitems = ax.get('plotitems')
00092                 plotitems.sort(_cmpPlotProperties)
00093 
00094                 l_ = False # Legend test
00095                 # Plot data
00096                 for item in plotitems:
00097                     # List not Implemented PlotProperties
00098                     if isinstance(item, (Volume, Streams)):
00099                         #Surface, Contours, VelocityVectors)):
00100                         raise NotImplementedError, \
00101                               'plotting of %s is not implemented in class %s'\
00102                               %(str(item.__class__), self.__class__.__name__)
00103                     elif isinstance(item, Streams):
00104                         pass
00105 
00106                     elif isinstance(item, Surface):
00107                         self._plotSurface_plotSurface(item, ax.get('shading'))
00108                         
00109                     elif isinstance(item, Contours):
00110                         x, y = meshgrid(item.get('xdata'), item.get('ydata'),
00111                                         sparse=False)
00112                         # filled?
00113                         contour = p.contour
00114                         if item.get('filled'):
00115                             contour = p.contourf
00116                         cs = contour(x, y , item.get('zdata'), item.get('clevels'))
00117                         if item.get('clabels'):
00118                             p.clabel(cs)
00119 
00120                     elif isinstance(item, VelocityVectors):
00121                         self._plotVector_plotVector(item)
00122                     # Lines
00123                     elif isinstance(item, Line):
00124                         try:
00125                             fmt = item.get('linecolor') + \
00126                                   self._markers_markers[item.get('linemarker')] + \
00127                                   item.get('linetype')
00128                         except KeyError, e:
00129                             pass#magic()('keyerror %s' %str(e))
00130                         
00131                         linewidth=item.get('linewidth')
00132                         if not linewidth:
00133                             linewidth=item.get('pointsize')
00134                         _plot = {'loglog': p.loglog,
00135                                  'semilogx': p.semilogx,
00136                                  'semilogy': p.semilogy,
00137                                  'linear': p.plot}[ax.get('scale')]
00138                         args = item.get('xdata'), item.get('ydata'), 
00139                         if fmt:
00140                             args = args + (fmt,)
00141                         l = item.get('legend')
00142                         if not len(l):
00143                             l = '_nolegend_'
00144                         else:
00145                             l_ = True
00146                         kwargs = {'label': l,
00147                                   'linewidth': linewidth,
00148                                   }
00149                         _plot(*args, **kwargs)
00150                 # Legend
00151                 if l_:
00152                     p.legend()
00153 
00154                 # Colorbar
00155                 if ax.get('colorbar').get('visible'):
00156                     cb = ax.get('colorbar')
00157                     print "Implement colorbar"
00158                     """p.colorbar(mappable=None,
00159                                cax=None,
00160                                orientation='vertical',
00161                                tickfmt='%1.1f',
00162                                cspacing='proportional',
00163                                clabels=None,
00164                                drawedges=False,
00165                                edgewidth=0.5,
00166                                edgecolor='k')
00167                                """

00169     def _plotVector(self,item):
00170         """Helper function for _replot"""
00171         p = self._g_g
00172         assert item.get('function') != 'quiver3'
00173         x, y = self._meshgrid_xy_meshgrid_xy(item)
00174         u, v = item.get('udata'), item.get('vdata')
00175         # Nice trick to normalize
00176         #fac = arrmax(arrmax(u**2+v**2))**.5 + 10**-15
00177         #def subtract(a,b):
00178         #    return a-b
00179         #fac2 = subtract(*item.get('xlim'))**2+subtract(*item.get('ylim'))**2
00180         #u /= fac
00181         #v /= fac
00182 
00183         # set arrowscale to 0 to prevent matplotlib's automatic tuning
00184         lc = item.get('linecolor')
00185         if not lc:
00186             lc = u**2+v**2 # color arrows by magnitude
00187         p.quiver(x, y, u, v, item.get('arrowscale'), color=lc, width=1.0)
00188 
00189     def _plotSurface(self, item, shading):
00190         print item.__class__, "is implemented soon"
00191         p = self._g_g
00192         assert item.get('function') == 'pcolor'
00193         x, y = self._meshgrid_xy_meshgrid_xy(item)
00194         self._g_g.pcolor(x, y, item.get('zdata'), shading=shading,)
00195         #import sys; sys.argv = []; magic()('magic in Contour')
00196 
00197     def _meshgrid_xy(self, item):
00198         # Get dense 2d arrays for x,y-coordinates
00199         x, y = item.get('xdata'), item.get('ydata')
00200         if rank(x) == 2:
00201             assert rank(y) == 2
00202         x = squeeze(x)
00203         y = squeeze(y)
00204         if rank(x) == 1:
00205             assert rank(y) == 1
00206             x, y = meshgrid(x, y, sparse=False)
00207         return x, y
00208         
00209     def _magic(self):
00210         """Start ipython session with namespace of instance"""
00211         magic()('Starting ipython session with namespace of instance\n'\
00212                 +repr(self)
00213                 )
00214         
00215     def hardcopy(self, filename=None, **kwargs ):
00216         self._replot_replot()
00217         if filename:
00218             self._g_g.savefig(filename, dpi=150, facecolor='w', edgecolor='w',
00219                             orientation='portrait'
00220                             )
00221         print "In hardcopy matplotlib"
00222
